text: Rosalie Lorraine Gill (1867 - 1898) was an American painter. ==Biography== Gill was born in 1867 in Elmira, New York. At the age of 12 she began studying in art in New York City, at the Art Students League of New York, and with William Merritt Chase. In the late 1880s moved to Paris where she studied with Alfred Stevens. In 1889 Gill exhibited at the Exposition Universelle and she exhibited her work at the Palace of Fine Arts and the Woman's Building at the 1893 World's Columbian Exposition in Chicago, Illinois. Gill remained in Paris, where she married Rene Lara in 1897 and held the title Comptesse de Chalan (Countess of Chaland). Gill died the next year, 1898, at the age of 31. ==Gallery== File:Lady with a Fan by Rosalie Lorraine Gill 1884.jpg|Lady with a Fan 1884 File:The New Model by Rosalie Lorraine Gill 1884.jpg|The New Model, 1884 File:Japanese woman by Rosalie Lorraine Gill.jpg|Japanese woman ==References== ==External links== * Category:1867 births Category:1898 deaths Category:American women painters Category:19th-century American women artists Category:19th-century American painters
title: Rosalie Lorraine Gill
